answers.text: Two wrestlers must make physical contact (typically palm-to-palm) in order to transfer this legal status.

qas.question: What are two things that can be done with tagging?
How long does a wrestler have to leave the ring once they are tagged out?

answers.text: has a 5-second count to leave the ring

qas.question: How much time does a wrestler have once they tag in?

answers.text: the one tagging in can enter the ring at any time, resulting in heels legally double-teaming a face.

context: In some team matches, only one entrant from each team may be designated as the "legal" or "active" wrestler at any given moment. <a0_0>Two wrestlers must make physical contact (typically palm-to-palm) in order to transfer this legal status.<a0_0/> This is known as a "tag", with the participants <a1_0>"tagging out" and "tagging in".<a1_0/> Typically the wrestler who is tagging out <a2_0>has a 5-second count to leave the ring<a2_0/>, whereas <a3_0>the one tagging in can enter the ring at any time, resulting in heels legally double-teaming a face.
